channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.description: Infinite Realms wants to turn beloved fantasy books with big followings into living, breathing game worlds.

item.title: Lebron James: A career for the history books and a $70 million property portfolio

item.title: How Yelp reviewed competing LLMs for correctness, relevance and tone to develop its user-friendly AI assistant
item.description: Yelp found that when it first launched a GPT-4o-powered AI chatbot, usage rates dropped. But training it to sound like a human changed that.

item.title: Diddy temporarily de-lists $61.5 million Beverly Hills mansion; he remains in jail
item.description: The 10-bedroom, 13-bath Holmby Hills property is back on the market, for the same price as the rapper awaits trial.

item.description: A Morgan Stanley analyst identifies the point where investors might find an attractive entry point to get back in the market.

item.title: Treasury yields slip as U.S. recession talk lingers

item.title: Mayo Clinic’s secret weapon against AI hallucinations: Reverse RAG in action
item.description: To tackle data-retrieval-based hallucinations in non-diagnostic use cases, Mayo Clinic has applied CURE reverse RAG paired with vector databases.
